title: Péter Szabó
text:
Péter Szabó (13 April 1899 – 21 September 1963) was a <a href="Hungarians">Hungarian</a> <a href="Association%20football">football</a> manager and player.
Club career.
Born in Budapest, Szabó played with <a href="MTK%20Budapest%20FC">MTK Budapest FC</a> where he won three consecutive championships. In 1919 he moves abroad and joins Austrian side <a href="Wiener%20AF">Wiener AF</a>, but after making only one appearance in the <a href="1919%E2%80%9320%20Austrian%20football%20championship">1919–20 Austrian football championship</a> he, along his former MTK and national team teammate <a href="Alfr%C3%A9d%20Schaffer">Alfréd Schaffer</a> sign with German side <a href="1.%20FC%20N%C3%BCrnberg">1. FC Nürnberg</a>. Szabó played a total of 43 games for Nurnberg and won the <a href="1920%20German%20football%20championship">1920 German football championship</a>. Next he played three seasons with <a href="Eintracht%20Frankfurt">Eintracht Frankfurt</a>. He also played with German sides <a href="FC%20Wacker%20M%C3%BCnchen">FC Wacker München</a>, <a href="Chemnitzer%20BC">Chemnitzer BC</a>, <a href="FSV%20Zwickau">Planitzer SC</a> and Polish side <a href="Ruch%20Chorz%C3%B3w">Ruch Chorzów</a>.
International career.
Péter Szabó made 12 appearances for the <a href="Hungary%20national%20football%20team">Hungarian national team</a> between 1916 and 1919.
Coaching career.
Peter Szabó had a long coaching career that includes clubs from Turkey, Germany and Hungary.
Honours.
MTK Budapest
1. FC Nürnberg
Eintracht Frankfurt
Chemnitzer BC
1. FC Köln
